reviews.review_msg: Her lectures were very clear and informative. However our exam made no sense. Lots of questions where we had to know specific names and dates rather than testing our knowledge of the different concepts and theories

Although Maaike is very accessible and caring about her students, the exams had questions regarding things we never studied in lecture or the textbook, which I find quite unfair. I am a 3rd year student who is used to writing, and the marking for the term paper was harsh for no reason. I would probably try another prof just in case.

-offers an option to get 2% extra credit
-online midterm that's easy
-her lectures are very interesting and keeps it easy to pay attention
-online tutorials where you just make questions up based on the weeks lecture and reading

Maaike is awesome! She provides interesting examples in her lectures that make even boring concepts more memorable. She also made it easy to get 2% extra credit. The exams were fair- she provided practice exam questions which are helpful to know what to study, especially since some of the practice questions ended up being on the exams.

Seriously cannot stand this prof. She is always talking about her malnourished cats and her exams suck. I am not the type of student to expect a good grade without work, But this prof ruins the atmosphere and doesn't encourage learning. She is not engaged in teaching, and is quite odd, to say the least. I will never ever take a class w her again

There is a textbook but I never read it and got a good mark anyways. Tutorial discussion is pretty easy and is basically just participation marks but still do it. Heavily reliant on lectures but they are pre-recorded so that's nice. 2 exams that are a bit hard to prepare for. Paper was pretty easy but make sure to choose a good topic and theory.

Lectures are straight forward. She also answers questions frequently, but the tests are quite tricky especially for the long-answer questions. It is very hard to get a decent mark in tests as she doesn't give a clear expectation. There is a rubric for the term paper but the TA can make you lose many marks without any reason

Save yourself the trouble and take with another prof! I am usually an A student but this class was a horrible experience. Her exams are brutal even though I basically the whole textbook and lecture slides memorized, and the paper was graded ridiculously tough. Not to mention the terrible TA who marked parts of my exam wrong although it was right!

during the corona online situation she missed 2 online lectures for basically no reason but expected us to learn them ourselves using the TB. acts like she cares but really doesnt. final was mainly all application questions which we never learnt to do, paper was marked so harshly especially when we didnt get help cuz corona like planned in tutorial

She seemed relaxed & is a nice person but really makes you work for it. Both midterm & final were difficult and tedious and lectures were mainly her reading the slides (had lots of good info tho) Her TA Suzanna was seriously the worst I've ever had. kinda rude & really didn't wanna be in tutorial like ever & gave no feedback on class work at all

I am extremely disappointed with her teaching style. I agree with the person who said she acts like she cares but actually doesn't. She expects us to be understanding of her during this pandemic ie. she misses 2 weeks of lectures but then makes the final exam even more difficult than it would have been in person. She's also extremely disorganized.

Professor Helmus is AMAZING, she's funny and intriguing in her lectures and explains the content very well. The textbook readings become super important in the last weeks of the class so don't skimp out on the readings! This course is quite heavy but worth it, there's a 10 page paper about a serial killer as well so that's quite cool.

Maaike is such a nice person who gives an opportunity for bonus marks. She makes lecture entertaining by saying jokes. However, her exams are very textbook-based and very specific. The average of the two exams was 60%. If you want an A in this class you have to make sure to study the textbook in depth.
She was really funny and the class had great vibes. A lot of fun and the the class is not very hard at all. I didn't use the textbook often but if I did I probably would have gotten a better grade.
The way of her teaching is easy to understand, engages the students and makes it a fun environment. Lectures are easily accessible. I enjoyed this class!

She gives an all out answer whenever you ask her a question and she will not bore you when she does her lectures. Make sure to listen carefully because most of her questions on the exam will be on relevant to her lectures. She also gives out extra percentages or extra work for students that wants additional grades. She is very nice and fun.

Dr Greer made this course very stimulating, she is passionate about the topic. Group presentations, class discussions, and pre-exam games/handouts help to make the material easy to learn. Assigned paper was on the harder side, but she is a fair marker for the entire course. Very kind and open prof.

Alissa is a great lecturer. I was intrigued by her lessons and learned a lot. Her crim 103 has a midterm and final exam, one term paper, a group project in your tutorials, and requires participation in tutorials. Not a bad class, just have to study up for exams and participate in tutorials which isn't bad at all.

Great prof, lectures are concise and organized. She provides lots of examples to help understand the material. Half of the material she tests on is from the textbook so you must read it!! Overall great class, there is one presentation that's worth 15% of the overall grade for the tutorial but its easy!
Great professor. Very good notes. Study her notes since a lot of her questions on the exams are on it. If you get bored in class, you can just stare at her. She is beautiful.
great prof

Chantal is a great prof. She cares about her students and is a very nice person. Her tests are very fair and she gives you a list of things to study before the midterm and final so you aren't lost when you study. The downside is that she is a very tough marker when it comes to papers.

Attendance is mandatory and participation is required it will affect the final grade. Exams are extremely easy and study guides are allowed for the midterm. The final is a take home exam. Very easy to pass the course as long as you show up and make a few comments in the discussions. No textbook all readings are free and online.

She was helpful in answering all my questions throughout her course. Her lectures are always released on time and it is expected you go over them and participate in activities within a reasonable time. I found her Final exam interesting. If you enjoy studying different behaviours and personality disorders and their causes you will enjoy her class.

Such a sweet and caring professor. Her lectures come straight from the book making it unnecessary - focus on lecture slides, read the summary at the end of chapters. Records lectures. Totally fair exams and projects. Definitely drop by her office hours.

shes super sweet!! felt bad for her cause no one would laugh at her jokes :( reads directly off slides. i didnt buy a textbook which was ok because he lecture is like a straight copy of the textbook. she records he lectures and posts full lecture slides so not many people showed up to class. tutorials really boost your mark so dont skip those

Her slides are straight from the textbook, and in lectures she read straight from them. Both the midterm and final were mc and written but the written on the midterm were super difficult. The essay and presentation were fairly easy and tutorial participation brought my mark up a lot.

Jodie is a LOVELY lady. She is super kind, funny, and understanding. However, I found that it was difficult to grasp concepts in class since she basically taught straight from the textbook and had nothing more to add to help understand the material better. I felt I would leave the class having to reteach myself content.

Fair exams, they covered everything that she said it was going to cover. I wasted money on textbook, because the exams were heavy on lectures. However, she did an amazing job at going over everything from the textbook, in the lectures. She is a great prof, is crazy smart, and cares for her students. I would definitely take another course with her.

Great prof, super caring and sweet! Yet she heavily relies on the slides and provides little to no explanation beyond the textbook. Her lectures EXACTLY follow the textbook. Exams were straightforward and fair as she explain they would be.

The lectures are extremely fast-paced but he explains everything in detail and is more than happy to clarify anything that wasn't understood. His lecture slides were thorough but he talks a lot about stuff that isn't on the slides and gives hints about the exam questions, so attendance is important. TAs were very sweet too. I  recommend this class!

Evan McCuish is the best prof I've ever had. Overall, lectures are fast-paced but very informative and he does stop for questions and to further explain a concept. Midterm and final were both multiple choice with the final having a few written questions. There is also a term paper and group project that reflects what is learned in the lecture.

He is amazing. He knows his material and knows exactly what to talk about in class without looking at his lecture slides. His exams are quite fair and easy, he will let you know what to focus on mostly. 95% of questions come from lecture material and 5% textbook. His assignment may look confusing but not hard enough to not achieve a good grade

He was a great professor. His class was interesting and very engaging. There were no weekly quizzes or heavy assignments except for the term paper, which if you start a little early, you'll do just fine. If you are interested in criminology and psychology, this is an interesting course, and he is a good professor.

Took this class online in Fall 2020 Great professor. I personally did not read the textbook for this class because Dr. McCuish's lectures were very informative and knowledgeable. Exams were fair and the final paper for this class was really engaging and marked fairly. Great guy.

One of the best profs I've ever had! I took this course my first semester (Fall 2019), and it honestly was a great class to ease into university. He's really clear in what he expects on assignments/exams and makes the material so easy to comprehend. You can tell he genuinely cares about his students and does his best to make sure everyone succeeds.

Professor McCuish was one of my favourite professors. He gives a clear grading criteria of what he expects on the paper. He is available for help whenever you need, and gives good advice. His exams are decent, put the work in and you can easily receive a good grade.

Evan is probably my favourite professor from all 4 years of my undergrad. He is super passionate and helpful. He makes concepts very clear through a variety of ways of explaining them. His online lectures are actually interesting to watch... which honestly is a miracle because online lectures are the worst! Would highly recommend him!!

Prof McCuish is hands down one of the most caring and amazing lecturer on SFU. He engages with the students and uses memes to tie in with the course materials; he ensures that the material given were easy to understand and follow. He also cares for his students and wants them to succeed. TIP: He really really likes Natalie Portman haha

He is really passionate about crim. Explains well and has good analogies to help you understand the material. He's pretty quick at responding to emails and is good at clarifying things. He really cares about helping you succeed by even making an extra vid on how to write papers (since it's an intro course) and tips on how to cite. The TA was good 2

My fav first year prof and he's such a cutie! Was really understanding of COVID circumstances and understood that many students were feeling stressed. Only one assignment for the whole sem and the tests are straightforward. Lectures are also very interesting and he has a good way of connecting concepts that helps all students to understand it well.

One of my favourite first year profs. His lectures are very interesting and he tries to make them relevant to today's world. No assignments except one paper and he gives very clear criteria which makes it easier to do. He was very understanding of the COVID circumstances and accommodated to students. Highly recommend taking this class with him
Really captures your attention good at relating to younger millennials.

This is my first semester at sfu and i haven't even finished this course yet but he is by far my favourite prof. Super passionate about what he teaches which makes it easier to stay engaged during lectures. Tests and assignments are straightforward and he has a clear criteria for what he is expecting. Would 100% take any course with him again!

He is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes the content less dry as it is is quite theory based. He does come off as being a bit arrogant but is willing to help and answer questions. the marking is pretty easy, just know his notes and you can get away without reading the textbook. would definitely take another class with him

Amazing prof, super passionate about teaching his stuff and knows it very well, has a good line of being fair to students but also doesn't take anything he really shouldn't student friendly overall loved taking his class and it was at 8:30 AM.
Evan was a great lecturer, he clearly cared about you learning and understanding the infromation. The exams were about 90% lecture material with 5 or so questions of stuff only from the textbook.
Sometimes give hints on what is going to be on the midterm/final in lectures. Group project was alright and got a fair mark. Term paper was very researched base.

Interesting lectures but exams can be a bit tricky, especially the multiple choice. He's looking for very specific answers that might just have been briefly mentioned in class. Make sure to attend lectures!

Very research-focused on presenting findings in lecture material, and the term paper is very heavy research-based. He's very serious and not very approachable but he is an engaging lecturer for an 8AM class.
terrible TA's will ruin this class.
I would 100% take another class with Evan. His lectures are interesting, even when the content is dry.
Lectures are just him reading off exactly what's on the powerpoint slides posted on canvas. The class was kind of boring and tutorials were pointless. But the class itself was easy enough.

He's a young hottie, knowledgeable,  and passionate about topics. Gives breaks in lecture. Lectures can be SO BORING, but it's not his fault. Posts lecture slides. Group project in tutorial  is bad though.

He makes it pretty clear what is going to be on the test. Most of the materials from the test comes from his lectures, but probably around 5 questions come from the textbook (I think skimming it is decent enough). Very clear and easy grader. Easy to get along. His lectures are not boring. Make sure you go to his lectures.

You know your prof is cool when he responds to your email in less than 5 minutes. Evan is great at explaining things and his lectures are interesting to listen to. Tests are fair and unlike some other crim profs, tests on what you know & understand rather than have you purely memorize specifics. Super great bc he encourages critical thinking.
Great prof with a knowledge of the material. Group presentations in tutorial but grading is fair. Need the textbook because he tests off of it but he provides powerpoint notes!

He is knowledgeable in what he is doing and I would recommend any CRIM students to take CRIM 103 with him. He explains well enough for you to understand the topics and will answer your questions if you have doubts.  Best prof I had for my very first CRIM course so far.

Great prof. He's precise, he knows what he is talking about, and he explains thing in a way that is very easy to understand. the material is interesting and he makes it more interesting as well. I would highly recommend taking this course with Evan!

Evan is extremely knowledgable and passionate about what he does. His lecture slides are helpful when it comes time to study for the midterm and final, but don't skip the textbook readings. Overall an interesting course and he explains things clearly, would take another class with him
very nice

Great prof, loved listening to the lectures. The amount of information in each slide was a little overwhelming but very thourough and informative, especially if you don't want to read the textbook. IMO researching and writing the term paper was super fun, and if you follow the criteria you'll get a great mark. My TA, Mira Dhaliwal was also amazing!

slides are pretty much the textbook in a condensed form--HOWEVER.. if you care to get A's on your exams, you should also read and study the textbook since she puts some information from the text on the exams. her multiple choice options are very difficult in the sense that you dont know if its A or C because both can be argued for

Suzanna was fantastic. Her grading criteria is very clear and she really sets every student up for success. She even offers activities to boost up your grade by 3%, which is helpful if you're between grades. Her lectures are heavy, but the content is interesting and she's very engaging. Exams are super fair and not hard if you prepare.

The lectures and topics themselves were super interesting. Dr. Michner herself was pretty chill and willing to give extensions to any assignments. She went through the material pretty fast but thorough. The lectures were recorded and the slides were posted which was super helpful. The written portions were large components of the exams.

Overall, she is a great prof. However, for a first-year university student, her grading can get overwhelming. Be prepared to write notes nonstop for her class from start to finish. Her test questions were pretty complicated compared to what she told what's mainly on it. However, she was great for allowing extensions at the last minute.

Suzanna is amazing! She is very kind, allows extensions if needed and easy to connect with via email. Her exams are basically entirely based on the lecture, so it's easy to do well if you attend or review them. 103 is content heavy and can be a difficult first year course, but she makes it easy. The term paper was short and had clear guidelines.

She was very nice and caring, and the course content was interesting but the final paper deadline wasn't quite fair. On the day it was due, she openly let people request an extension if they weren't done yet, which isn't fair to the people who met the deadline.

She's really sweet and has such a good energy. Very accommodating, gives extensions. Lectures are content heavy and the exams are tough, but it's a comprehensive intro class. I didn't get the textbook and I did just fine. Study hard and you'll be alright. She provides very clear expectations for the exams and paper. I would highly recommend!

She is really understanding and provides a chance to boost your grade by 3%. If you need an extension,  don't hesitate to ask her as she is very lenient. Reading your textbook is very important for this class if you want to be able to understand what the lecture is discussing. She provides detail information about midterm and final.

I found tests were graded quite hard and there was a LOT of content. I spent the most time out of all my classes studying for this course's exam. She is very understanding and lenient with extensions and offers a 3% boost in final grade. Very sweet and kind but lectures were very content heavy. Not the easiest class for GPA booster.

Dr. Michener was caring and understanding offering up to 3% extra credit. However, I do believe for a first year course, the paper and exams were graded much too harshly and the written exam questions as well. Her lectures were very content heavy and anything may appear on the exam as well

Suzanna cares about her students and it shows. She is lenient within reason, and she is also passionate about the things she teaches. However, she is not that great of a lecturer, though she makes up for it by being so understanding.
Great teacher who makes sure every student is ready for their exams. Exams are by the lecture.

Dr. Michener has a clear course layout. Her lectures are quite full, so be sure to read the textbook chapter beforehand to keep up with the lecture content (lectures are recorded). The TSSU strike did complicate dates, but she adjusted relatively well. The final term paper was fine, just be sure to research well and don't leave it until the end.

Great professor, she wants her students to succeed and do well in her class. I would highly recommend taking this course with her. She is very easygoing and makes your semester and life easier. She prepares many activities for tutorials which are very helpful to study. She consider's students opinions in everything which most profs don't do at SFU

This course is interesting and the topics are fun to learn. I would recommend skimming through the TB before each lecture, since the slides are very long and packed with information. The paper is real easy if you do enough research on it, if you don't then it's gonna be hard to meet the word count requirement.
There is so much info on the slides and it will all show up on the midterm and final. This class had a presentation, paper, midterm, and final making it a super time consuming course

Her lectures were long but informative, so reading the TB prior is a good idea to not get as overwhelmed. The midterm was online and long, but the final was more reasonable in length for the time given. We had an 8-page final paper that was marked fairly tough for a first-year course, in my opinion. The course content was overall interesting.

Dr. Michener is a talented teacher of all things. I'm convinced she could teach me anything. Lecture heavy, but they're so interesting. Read the textbook prior to class and it will keep you more engaged in lecture as it minimizes the chances you'll be overwhelmed by content. She always seemed extremely understanding.

SO much information is packed into her lectures, adding new information to what the textbook says. No break during her lecture, but they're recorded. Exams were long, and the time to finish the midterm was too short with lots of people not finishing. Presentation and paper were easy. She's a cool person, but her teaching style is not for everyone.

Midterm is online, but it was pretty long, had to leave some questions blank cuz of the time limit. Final exam, 90 MC questions + 10 short answer questions, but you get 3 hours to do it. Overall, tests were pretty heavy, make sure to study the material

Pretty heavy lectures, she reads off of her notes and speaks pretty fast, so hard to take notes. There's a presentation with 10% which was pretty easy (depending on the TA). The paper was pretty short (2200 words max, but overall, I would not take this class again. Also, no breaks during her lectures...so just read the textbook.

This class was heavy. Use the textbook and go to the lecture. The lectures are boring overloaded with 50 slides at least and are so fast it is hard to take notes. Her midterm was too long to finish and many people left questions blank due to the short amount of time. The final paper and presentation aren't too bad but the paper is long. Not good.

Suzanna is wonderful! Clear grading criteria, helpful power points, and interesting content that made all the reading bearable! Weekly assignments, midterm, final exam + final paper (8 pages)! CRIM103 is definitely one of my favourite courses.

Ehor is a very intelligent man who has decades of experience within the field. I often felt he was too knowledgeable to teach this course, or didn't want to. I liked him a lot as a professor but he did none of his own marking. He did not even provide TA's with marking expectations for MT. The TA's he had (Hilary) were awful. Final was random...
He was a great prof. But his TA were no good. The material was really good and came right from the textbook. Midterm fair, but the TA didn't mark fairly! Final m/c fair. An easy B class.

His lectures are interesting and he stuck almost word for word to the textbook he wrote himself. I loved the material so I enjoyed going to class. The midterm was fair and if you spent just a day studying you could easily get a B. The final is a different story. It is extremely difficult. Content of the course is awesome. His teaching is average.

He's a very interesting person with lots of interesting story, but is a horrible lecturer. He often goes off on tangets and his powerpoints make no sense. You never know what to study for the exams, which are all over the place. His TAs are also hard markers. Would not reconmend taking 103 with him.

He is a brilliant person and researcher. His work is really commendable and interesting. But i hope we used some textbook to refer to. It's like i don't know where to study from. I like him as a person. I just wish he was a better professor.

Worst professor I've ever had at SFU, hands down.  No textbook to refer to, and trying to study his lectures is torture considering how often he went off topic and rambled on and on.  He might be a fun person, but he wasn't a good professor. Stay away from this class!

I like Ehor as a person, but as a lecturer he falls short. It's nice to hear history stories, etc., but not if it means students aren't taught proper course content. Class average on the midterm was 67%...and for one tutorial it was 57%. I would not recommend taking this class solely because unfortunately the lectures are very disorganized, although the Prof seems nice.

though many people said his courses are fun and easy but i must agree with the person that just posted he did infact tried new textbooks and his age does seem to get better of him as rambles about topics like fishing during lectures
Nice guy. very interesting lectures... his midterm was tough. Know your theories! Final is so random...

i loved this course! .. Boyanowsky is a great professor, make sure you attend his lectures and take great notes, otherwise you will not succeed .. his midterm was a little difficult but if you take good notes, then you'll do great-->they are based on his lecture notes ..& as for the final, most of the ?'s come from the textbook .& titi is a good TA
I am going to touch (twice) my female teacher assistant and show you guys what is an assault.Come on seriously. Do we really need to go that far.
I am going to touch (twice) my sexy female assistant and show you guys what is an assault. Come on seriously Ehor!

The Professor has a lot of experience probably too much for a teacher. The problem is when a teacher gets old they start to take thing not seriously like once he came in class and said he forgot his lecture notes on his desk. Also he himself said he was not prepared for this semester because he used to have 80 students in his class.

Oh yeah. And Titi doesn't seem comfortable in her position. Nice girl, but not, NOT, a good TA. If you ask her questions, she'll tell you to re-read your textbook, or look up the answer on the internet.

Anyone that complains about Ehor going off topic is a boring, dry student without much soul in their bones. Boyanowsky tells the greatest stories, and all of them have to do with the material, and you will REMEMBER everything he teaches. He doesn't use slide shows, he just talks, and he knows his stuff. You'll want to buy this man a beer.

He was so much fun! I enjoyed the lectures as well as the course material. There's quite a bit of content so students actually have to read the textbooks and take notes. I think people are only harsh on him because he's a fair marker and rewards hard work over giving out free grades.

hav to attend lectures!! mt was easy.. but soo much 2 write & its 30% textbook n the rest on his lectures.. so take good notes! p.s. only a very simple outline available n the ta, titi.. shes just.. >.> bad ta

Ehor is a nice guy. He can go off topic a lot and important information doesn't get covered. But overall a pretty decent guy. Titi is the only TA and she is brutal. She doesn't listen and can't answer questions, her english is poor. She marked the midterm based on her knowledge and notes from lecture, the prof gave no marking scheme.

Boyhanowsky seems scattered in his lectures. He doesn't relate anything to hi readings. You do not have to attend lecture, just read the longgg chapters of the text and you should be okay. Titi was his only TA, she doesnt seem to get along with anyone. so watch your back with her. Her english wasnt very good and she had a hard time remembering name

His lecture is very interesting however it's not related to the readings. There are so much readings to do including tutorial reading. Oh, if your TA is TiTi, change it!! She doesn't speak any English, nor know any course materials..if you ask her any questions, she will tell you to google it up or use wikipedia. Exam is both from lecture and readi

Lectures are very interesting, listening to them again online is a must! Text book is boring,and although sometimes unclear, it does tie in well with the lectures! Not lecturing the book however, but they both work together! I had TiTi as my TA, although her English isn't great, she puts in time and effort and she was fine. She was kind of cute.

Overhead outline + Listen to records online = good. Not very organize with the reading though, did not bother to correct the errors on reading list till 1 week before midterm. A good speaker in class though, very clear.

He's a great teacher! He's fun to listen to class, and entertaining. Though his lectures may not always have to do with the textbook, but it's still helpful, and he even says it himself. The material is interesting, and if you get Holly as your TA - she's just great! I loved this class. Great prof! =)

he doesnt go over anything from the textbook..!! his lectures are fun to listen to..but reading the long chapters? and TAs are the worst of all..I dont think they know what they are teaching, the questions that we go over at tutorials dont even come out in the exams..!!oh, if you see TiTi as TA, dont ever take that class, she doesnt know english

exams are all lists. so remember everything off each slide. He goes off on tangents but it's okay. Makes you read the book which is sooooooo boring. His TA Jessica was useless and never available so don't rely on the TA for help.but still he's better than jenifer wong

He engages with his students a lot. He does go off on tangents a little. but it usually is relevant to the course. I found his notes extremely helpful, even when he could't cover parts of the textbook in detail, he told us specifically what to focus on. Midterm/Final was fair, not difficult (contrary to other ratings) overall fun + fair prof.

Lectures are ok and sometimes interesting(relates to his personal life). Likes discussions. Doesn't cover every topic in detail in lecture but has a slide at the end of each lecture that lists things to focus on in textbook (80% lecture, 20% text). Midterm/final were long & difficult especially the MC but SA was okay if you studied. Hard marker.

This class sucked, and verrrrry boring. Don't bother going to class because he goes off topic so much. You're better off just reading the textbook. Exams are unreasonable and not enough time to finish them. Worst crim class ever. He's an ok dude, but tries way too hard to be "cool".

Bryce doesn't read ratemyprof. BUT nonetheless, he is a good guy. Hilarious, young, new prof who knows his stuff. He tries to make things as clear as possible and is very helpful (esp. when you ask him for help 1-on-1). Relaxed lectures shouldn't fool you - you must work hard for an A. Good guy, good class. Would recommend!
Amazing prof! Makes every concept interesting. Highly recommend him!
Had Bryce as my TA a while back. Extremely hard and even somewhat unreasonable marker. Went off topic a lot in tutorials. Was willing to help though and was nice.
Amazing lectures, very interesting and inspirational but a very hard marker with difficult tests.

One of the best Prof's I've had. She is hard but don't judge by the grades. She makes you work for your grade but in the end, rewards learning and progress (you'll know what I mean by that)! She is extremely knowledgeable and funny, and makes her lectures interesting. I'd definitely take courser with her in the future!

You MUST READ your textbook or you won't pass. She's a hard marker and designs her class assuming you've read the chapter she's going to talk about in lecture. She talks about new things not found in the textbook that are related to the topic 60% of the time, the other 40% is from the textbook. Little info given on her slides.

Hilary is funny and entertaining in her lectures as she is interested in what she teaches. However, the mid-term was ridiculous. The "short answer" are not short answers. She expects too much for a first year course. This class will make your GPA drop.
LOVE HER

I've had Hilary for 4 Crim classes now, and some of these comments just show me that those students didn't try. It's not an easy mark, but not unreasonable. Yeah, she's a little bit neurotic and I can see how you'd think she was intimidating, but she knows what she's talking about and will really help you out if you go talk to her. Nice lady.

She expects way too much from first year students. Probably the hardest class I have taken. Her exams are okay, but the time allotted is ridiculous!! She expects students to finish short answers (designed like long answers) to be done in as less as 50 minutes. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Not sure why the rating is so low. Took her first semester of uni and got an A-. (Probably could have done better). I'm not saying it's easy but it is manageable.  Make sure you keep up with everything!! About her attitude - I think people just don't get her sarcastic humour? I thought she was hilarious. Was also really helpful in office hours!

She is a tough prof for sure. She makes you work really hard. Her reasoning for being so tough on first year students is to build your skills and prepare you properly for upper level learning. Attend classes, read your text book and prepare to work hard and you'll do fine. She's great and so much fun!

Her class brought my GPA down.   Most lectures stray so far from the textbook its impossible to study for tests.  I find Hilary to be condescending to students and the ego is huge.  I wouldnt take her class again if my degree depended on it.
STAY away. She will destroy your GPA and your dreams! Her exams too length and she expects you to know the textbook, short answers aren't short they are LONG ANSWERS!

Hilary is hilarious and extremely knowledgable. Her lectures are fun to attend. Her tests are hard, not in the sense that the questions are difficult, but because you have so many questions in so little time. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat! You need the text  and attending lectures will result in better grades, trust me!

Her lectures are very fast-paced. She is strict but fair. This is not a class that you can "cruise" to pass. If you are not really interested in criminology as a discipline, this is probably not a good elective to take. Her lectures are very interesting.

WORST CLASS EVER. There's just too much for us to memorize. And she expects way too much from us. Her short answers are horribly difficult because she doesn't tell us what she expects, and apparently she expects very specific details which normal students probably won't be able to remember. Midterm average was 45% and it's not curved. DONT TAKE IT.

I'm doing really well in her class but not because she has been of any help. Morden is one of the most self-righteous, nasty instructors I have ever met. I have never ever heard a good thing about her teaching so why is she still teaching??? She is condescending and rude to students. Would  NOT recommend
Probably the hardest class I've ever taken. I think the LSAT stressed me out less. You vs a bad grade is 300 Spartans vs an entire Persian army.
Just don't do it.   So many regrets.

One of the worst profs I've had.  Her incredibly large ego and a self-righteous demeanour was unpleasant to experience. Additionally exams were very difficult to prepare for due to a lack of clarity in what students were expected to know. Unrealistic expectations for a first year course. Do not take a class with her unless you have no other option.

hold onto your seat during this course! INFORMATION OVERLOAD is no exaggeration. ALL written long answer & case study (essay) for mid-term & final. Unreasonable expectations of content memorization. Unclear delivery, confuses concepts, misspells names. Interesting content though. Somewhat useful to see in office hrs/appt if you can get one! YIKES!

While Hilary is definitely interested in the subject matter, she does not plan a course very well. If you take her class, make sure you take extra time understand what she expects from you. It is possible to do well in her class however, she doesn't make it easy, and not by making the course difficult but by having very specific expectations.

She does expect you to treat this like a university course.  She cares - gives out her personal cell number.  She wants you to do well and will do whatever it takes to help you get there.  But you will have to work - this is university after all.

She was very fair, it was a challenging course and I had to put effort in to do well. Don't expect to pass, if you don't want to take the time to study. But if you follow her advice you will do just fine.
stay away if you want to save your GPA, worst proff ever. So rude and her attitude is terrible.
Hilary is an amazing prof! she can be really tough but she is always there to help and offers an amazing experience. Keeps the class entertained thats for sure!
learning so much i am! so interesting it is.  recommend this class i do
The entire mid term was on her lecture notes. don't buy the text book I don't even own it and im passing
She is one difficult TA.
nit picky and difficult TA. Her attitude toward students is condecending and mean. take her if u want to kill your GPA

Her attitude towards students is condecending, mean and rude. so nit picky who takes mark off for extra space between period in APA format? Class average was C- but apparently nothing wrong with her and prof and everything's OUR fault. Well shes always right u just have to suck it up. So full of herself

WORST TA ever. Shes just bad tempered and her attitude toward students is condescending mean and rude. Also nit picky. Who takes marks off for extra space between period in APA format? She doesnt know what its like to be a student and so self-righteous that even if the class average is C-, its OUR fault for not studying enough, not hers.
Worst prof EVER! She is mean and unhelpful. Her lectures are boring. Not recommended AT ALL!
Hillary is the worst Crime prof that I v ever experienced in SFU. She is selfish, mean, condescending students and she ll make you hate Criminology. I don't command her at all

Hilary can be really nice and has some good stories, but from my experience & from what I've seen she's impatient dealing w/ students. I've had her as both a T.A & a professor, & honestly, I would not recommend her for either role; she can come off as condescending when you ask a question & even via dist. ed. she's unapproachable! Hard marker.

Unreasonably hard class. . No structure in either lectures or tutorials. Gave us a terrible textbook that was no help whatsoever, then gave the most vague notes possible and still expected in depth analysis on exams... Take this class with a different prof and stay clear of the TA (Bryce) he is nice but useless and an unreasonably hard marker

When she does not record her lectures or do not allow students to record, she should at least be clearer in her slides. When she is whizzing through 50+ slides in 1hr50mins, it is very hard to keep up. There's A LOT of information you'll need to know in order to feel like you've done okay in the exams. Really harsh marker as well.

Take this course if you don't care about your grade. Her lectures are not organized. Textbook is not needed. Exams are hard, the average of the midterm was 65%. She is a tough marker. So shocked when I got my paper back. Stuffs could've been interesting but this course was so boring. Tutorials were meaningless. Don't expect anything for this course

She seems like a nice person, and can be funny. Pretty good, considering she's not a seasoned lecturer. That said, her tests, and the course in general, were too hard for a 100 level crim course. Also, the textbook was useless (though, this is not her fault). Only take this class if it is required for your program, regardless of the prof.
When the average on exams is literally only 60% in an intro CRIM course, theres obviously something wrong with the prof and TA, not all 105 students...
Text is useless, TA and her can't agree on anything. Honestly, nobody seems to know what's going on. She even contradicts herself regularly.
She is nice but this course is way too hard though it is 100 level. Exams are difficult and sometimes lectures are not well organized. Tutorials are also sometimes full of meaningless stuffs.

She is nice but this course is way to hard for an intro CRIM class. The avg is like 65% when it should be 75% since its not curved. The TA (Bryce) is helpful and nice but can be an unreasonable marker for a 100-level course, and since Hillary gives poor lecture notes and the textbook is a very poor choice, it is difficult to do well.

Don't even bother with this woman as your TA. Marks you like you are in your 4th year and expects way too much from students. Too nit picky. If she is your TA either drop or switch. Your gpa depends on it.

Everyone on here complaining about failing the course might want to look in the mirror and self-reflect. Lots of readings for the class, but manageable as it's an online course. Dr. Wong was very efficient with responding to emails and had in-person office hours every week. If you failed, it might be a you problem and not a her problem...
how are people still taking this course with her... drop it right now if you even think of considering taking this class with her.

DROP RIGHT NOW! DON'T EVEN THINK OF TAKING THIS CLASS WITH HER. Idk how she's still a prof at SFU. She is insanely difficult for no reason. The materials she make us read and learn has nothing to do with what she expects to see on the exams. No guidance whatsoever. Take it with another prof for the sake of your own peace of mind.

Looking at everyones review for her, all i could say is I agree. For the sake of your own GPA please please please avoid her at all cost. I'm on academic probation because of her. Thanks for the so-called help Jennifer.

AVOID AT ALL COST! I took this class as a requirement and her materials had nothing to do with what was on the midterm and final exam. Every week there is more than 10 pages of lecture material to read and you need to memorize all of it, just for it to not be on the exam. TAs are heavy markers, probably even biased. Just take it with Brenda.

Agree with most of the other reviews for the course. There are weekly discussion posts which aren't too hard, but the exams are mostly written answer (some being 8 points a question), as well as a 15 page term paper. To pass the exam (most didnt), focus solely on the written "lectures" and study the ideas mentioned and you will pass, but avoid tbh

AVOID THIS PROF AT ALL COSTS! The weekly lecture slides and textbook readings took 10x longer than a normal class. Midterm had trick mutliple choice questions, and short answer questions on topics not covered in lecture. term paper is marked hard, and prof will not grant extensions even for medical reasons. hardest course i have ever taken

Avoid prof. Worst TA's ever they mark so hard and the midterm was so hard and marked poorly. Majority of the class is probably failing right now. She doesn't even curve the classes which she clearly needs to do. Never take class with her!!!
do not take this class dr wong is not a good prof what so every she does not be clear about stuff
DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HER CLASS! The midterm was absolutely irrelevant! everything that we learned throughout the semester was not on the test

Professor Wong's class was challenging, but manageable if you stay engaged. Attend lectures, take detailed notes, and utilize resources like the textbook and unstuck study for exam prep. The grading can be tough, but the content is interesting.

This has been the worst prof I have had and many bad profs. Her tests are 90% short answer questions each worth up to 10 points. She barley posts her lectures which are filled with content. The TA's are no help and grade extremely hard. She laughs about how low the final averages are and does not curve her exams. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

People have been complaining saying that this class/professor is difficult. Personally I found that even if you just study what she taught in lecture you will do fine. Only a few assignments and they were graded fairly. Her lectures are well paced. Don't take her if you aren't willing to show up to class- she won't always post the slides.

This class was the hardest class I have ever taken. I am a fourth year political science student and never has a professor expected so much from a class. She acts as though we have no other courses to do or a life outside of the class. Exams and midterms are horrid, exceptionally hard and she laughs about the average grade being a 65. Don't take it

TLDR; Doesn't care much about the struggle of the students, tutorials are interesting

You have to be at the lectures, the TAs grade harshly, the tests are extremely difficult and made to confuse you. She provides easier bonus questions for extra points at the end though. Note taking in lecture is absolutely necessary and there is a LOT.

Shes unequivocal about her expectations of us students. She shares some of her lecture slides, and for the rest you have to take notes. The readings are heavy but provide great understanding, and her lectures complement the text. Memorize key concepts for finals, the important stats, + actually pay attention, and you will be fine. I liked her class

I'm 50/50 on this proffesor. The class is an exceptionally interesting one and the lectures were super engaging and actually interesting. I took tons of notes and studied lots however and that did not make a difference on the exams. Her exams are insanely difficult and the midterm average was like 54%?? Got above the average grade with a C+.. yikes

Horrible Prof. Reads off words to words from slides but expects students to take additional notes? Slides are not complete so you have to read the heavy text. The grading criteria are very vague and the TAs are not helpful. Prof left after playing videos and does this often. You can maybe pass the exam if you remember the whole textbook. Avoid her!

One of the best prof I have had. The lectures are engaging, and tutorials are super easy to participate in. The concepts are easy they just take time to memorize and learn. If you go to lectures, read the textbook, and study well, you will do great. And, the statistics tested are only from the lecture, which is reasonable!

WILL NOT TAKE MEDICAL NOTES

I fell ill a bit before the term paper & final were due. I went and got a Doctors note. She ignored my doctors note & demanded more personal medical information. Physically unable to study, I flunked the final. I dropped from an A- to a B.

This class was the WORST I've ever had. There was no guidance from the TA's or Professor Wong. The modules were dense, with all text and no recorded lecture or even interactions with any human being. The midterm was decent, the final exam was ALL stats-based and didn't even feel like a crim exam. The instructors for the paper were vague.

Professor Wongs is a horrible professor. She gives you a total of 45 minutes for 40 MC and a 30 point written which is just unrealistic. She wastes test questions by asking you questions that require memorization of statistics instead of theory which I find useless since understanding theory is more important in this class. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

Distance Ed modules were fine, paper was long for a 100-level class but not too terrible (haven't got marks back yet though). Exams are UNBELIEVABLY HARD, I can't believe how unreasonable they are. 45min for 35 MC and 1+ essay questions. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU'RE LOOKING TO BOOST YOUR GPA!

Took her DE class and was the worst class I've ever taken. All her lectures are just a bunch of text on a module and are very difficult to follow. Weekly discussions were fine. Her midterm and final were terrible. 38 multiple choice plus 2 essays in 45 mins. She even says she wants us to be rushed. They are also closed book. Would NOT recommend!
There were no recodings in this class, just lecture readings which made it super boring and reading heavy. The timing for the tests were so short and the tests were difficult.

This course had no recorded lectures or slides, just written notes summarizing the textbook and articles. Dr. Wong had little involvement in the course, besides some affirming comments about discussion posts and about the midterms 65% average. The midterm and final exam was 45 minutes for 36 questions which was not enough time to read or write qns

This class was not hard if your willing to do some reading. I'm not sure why everyone is complaining I found the layout of this class easy and exams were not cumulative If you just read the modules and skim the textbook this class is not bad

Class material wasn't tough but the prof had no live lectures or online video lectures. For each lecture she posts long detailed notes on the topics and that's all. You are only graded on 2 exams, discussion posts, and a term paper. You have only 45 minutes to complete each test that has 30+ multiple choice question and one long answer question.

I would not recommend taking her for a distance ed class. She would just post lecture notes that were from the book and did not engage with students in any other way. You basically have to teach yourself and the tests are pretty difficult and have nitpicky questions.

First of all, the class average on the midterm was a D... Ive never failed a course at SFU. Jennifer Wong is the absolute worst, switch out of the class if you have her. The TA's were useless. The only positive thing I can say is the lectures weren't boring and they had good information. The tests were completely random - nothing from lectures.

Her lectures were boring and she was a decent professor. The exams were quite difficult since they focused on statistics and lists. The paper was kinda annoying, but maybe because I did it a week before it was due. Tutorials were pretty fun and easy.

The course material itself is pretty straightforward, expect to be memorizing lists and statistics for exams. As a non-Crim student, lectures could feel dry at times, but Jennifer attempts to keep students engaged through personal anecdotes. Tutorial participation was a breeze. Start your term paper early!!
Such an amazing prof who makes lectures super interesting. Tests are easy if you make the time to study and learn the material.
Very knowledgeable. But doesnt post slides and expects first years to have an understanding of all material.

Jennifer is a good prof and i enjoyed her lectures. Her tests are very hard and specific, but if you study hard you will be ok. The class itself is interesting. She does not release grades so you will not know yours marks.

Dr Wong is very difficult. Midterm had to be remarked because the grades were so low. Exams are very specific. Overall I wouldn't take a class with her again unless I wanted to fail. Should of curved the midterm!
Probably the worst professor at sfu

Personally I really enjoyed taking crim103 with Professor Wong. Her tests are easy if you study slides, the average was a D for the midterm & tests had to be remarked to move it up to a C- . Textbook is not needed as her tests are based mostly off of her slides. Shes very knowledgeable and class is super interesting. Slides not posted on canavas
A considerate and caring teacher, especially in comparison to the institution that employs her.
Best prof ever. Such a sweetheart for cancelling our exam in terrible weather conditions. From the class of crim 103, we love you Dr Wong!
Super considerate
She is very considerate and takes her students interests very seriously. She is a true gem

took this class online but it was so difficult, TA did all the work and didnt even do a good job. tests were awful, questions were so specific and worth a lot. 10 page paper was not bad but you arnt graded on many things. would not take this prof again for anything.
One of the best profs i ever had, if you write good notes you will pass easily.

Although the course was taken online, feedback and engagement with students could be used like other DE courses I have taken. The TA did all the work, and didn't even do a great job either. The course is heavily graded on exams and she doesn't even prepare you for them at all unless you are able to read and remember the entire textbook.

I absolutely adore this prof. She seems strict in lecture but shes extremely approachable during her office hours. Overall, the material is pretty easy. Pure memorization. She likes to test on listing questions so if you memorize lists, you're pretty much set. Also, she gives about 15 marks worth of bonus points for the midterm and final!!

Its a hard class, but TBH I really liked her. Do the readings & take notes!! If you take down the powerpoint slides and fill in the gaps with the readings, the exams are easy. Only focus on the material from lecture, ignore unmentioned info in the readings. Tests are 75% short answer, so study hard.  Participation matters in tutorial.

Midterm was a bit unfair b/c 80 MC questions had to be answered in 40mins which does not give you enough time to properly read the questions.  TA was not really helpful since she preferred answering questions on canvas discussion page, final was super hard since it was SA worth 70pts,  recommend memorize all the notes especially anything with LISTS

An average prof in every sense of the word. She doesn't give you a reason to hate the class, but doesn't really give you a reason to particularly enjoy it either. Excellent slide-narrator though, if that's what you're into. Tests are 75% short-answer, so you need to memorize a lot. Overall, not super difficult, but you have to put in some work.

Her exams are really long and hard. Can easily fail if you didn't memorize the full lists of info. Make sure to memorize EVERYTHING she has on her slides. TA marks really hard but her tutorials are quite fun and easy marks

The workload of this course is not bad. However, the TA's mark very hard. They don't even give part marks. That obviously will make/break you with the midterm & final. Midterm is memorization of the lecture; u think its straight forward but it isn't. TA's are unfair and hard markers. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! SAVE UR GPA!! TAKE WITH DIFF PROF!!
Easy enough class as long as you study. Pure memorization on the exams. You have to write down a lot during her lectures so I would recommend using a laptop.

If you have a chance to take 103 with Dr. Wong, do it! She's a great speaker and she knows a lot about her field of study. Her exams are very fair straight up memorization from her lectures. However, she doesn't post her lecture notes so class is mandatory. She never tests students on statistics in crime and the paper was very straight forward.

Her lectures are quite interesting.  Had her for my tutorial, she's hilarious. No need to remember stats and percentages, but it is helpful on the midterm and for your paper.  Midterm was on textbook and slides (not posted online).  If you study hard, you'll get a good mark. Midterm really tests what you know. Final based on post midterm material.
Textbook wasn't necessary, overall made this course harder than it should be. TA was horrible. Can make/break you. Long lists, not really informative. Good luck.

I dont know why people say she is difficult. Honestly her exams are just straight up memorization of lists. She's nice and approachable, wanting you to do well. I don't get how you can study and fail her class, because honestly if you do its your own fault

Firstly shes actually very attractive and this coming from a girl. And you can either do really well or really bad. I studied day before got an A on the midterm where as the girl beside me got an F and one got a C-. The class itself is interesting, and would def take it again.
Super intelligent and well spoken. She's down to earth, but comes accross as unapproachable. If you do need or ask for her help, shes super warm and willing to help you!
Horrible teaching methods. I can read slides on my own thank you. Difficult to do well in this class. Thinks very highly of herself.

A lot of people may say she is hard, but they probably didn't study then. SHE LOVES LISTS, so if there is a list it will be on the tests. Tests are long but they are generally easy if you study and she takes out questions if the majority of the class didn't get them. Also she is SMOOOOKING hot all the guys agree with me. Interesting material also

Good teaching but she doesn't post lecture slides and it makes it tough to listen and note take at the same time. Regardless, most of the exam material is from the text. Those who say that no matter how much you study you wont do well are wrong. I studied and got an A.

Term paper instructions were slightly confusing but the TA would clarify by email in depth. Term paper marking was also fairly generous. Both finals and midterms required a large amount of studying but everything did come from the notes or the coursepack. I loved how the TAs and Wong responded to emails in a timely fashion.

Unbelievable marking scheme. I am a third year student who had previous knowledge of most of the material.I felt I was doing well in this course until I got my marks back. I knew the material, I read the text, I studied for the test and my mark was WAY below expected. It's beyond me why a first yr class would have such a ridiculous marking scheme.

her exams are tough, you really have to know the material inside and out,i got a 90% on her midterm though, but it was not easy. She is very smart and knows what she's talking about, lecture is not borring, but its hard to write and listen to her explain at the same time. You also have to remember the experiments she talks about durring lecture
Talks very fast but knows her material inside and out. Exams are very difficult and the term-paper is not clear since TA and Prof have different expectations.

The only thing I do not really like is that while copying down the notes she will discuss them, and I am not so great at multitasking so I will either neglect one or the other. She is a good teacher and really knows her stuff.

She's not horrible, but I'm taking her class right now, it is pretty hard for a first year course. TONS of notes, tests are on all notes and course pack. Tests are very tedious when it comes to detail, so remember it all and she gives you a short amount of time, especially for the midterm considering the amount of questions.
Midterm was fair with all questions coming from text or lecture. Includes bonus questions. Only concern is the lack of time for the amount of written questions she gives.
Had this class a while ago, this is my 3rd year in university and without a doubt she has the worst lecture/notes of any of the profs i have ever had

I took her 103 class in fall 2009. I have to say, for a 100 level course, it's pretty hard. The exams cover far too much material, and the readings are ridiculously long. Right now I have to take crim 220, and I'm scared as hell I'll get Jennifer Wong again. LIKE REALLY SCARED because I need a good gpa for when I apply for exchange.
she is a good prof.. Her exams are little bit hard, but if you read textbook and lecture notes, you will do fine.
A lot of boys thought she was hot but i thought she talked tooo fast!
personally,i think she is a good prof...

Honestly, the person below is an idiot. Her exams are tough, but very very fair. There are no suprise questions, and if you study there is absolutely no reason why you wouldn't do well. I didn't study as much as I should have and still got a good grade. I actually really enjoy her class, and find her to be one of the best profs I have had..

WHAT A TERRIBLE TEACHER! COULD HER EXAMS BE ANY HARDER? Especially for an into class. Do NOT take this class with Jennifer Wong. You will study as hard as you can and still fail the exam. For goodness sakes, half the class failed the midterm! I am not looking forward to the final. I finished h.school w/a 4.0 GPA from one of the leading schools..

Shes an absolutely terrible prof, goes super fast, gives vague descriptions of what to expect on the final such as "everything learned so far" and if u ask her anything in depth she laughs and says "oh i can't tell you that" even tho the prof is supposed to help students focus attention on certain aspects. She sucks, the worst prof ever. Fin.

Jennifer is extremely helpful and genuinely interested in the topic. Exams are challenging, but not impossible, and she offers bonus marks to up your grade. Will evaluate if question is unfair and eliminate it. Unfortunately, she chooses the worst TAs imaginable, who mark extremely low on the term paper and are generally useless.

useless. Teaches next to nothing, expects you to get ALL your learning from reading the text. Readings are ridiculously long for a 100 level class, and the questions she chooses for the exam require excessive detail or you get nothing. Stay away. I took 103 for interest and to help my grade...so far I have a C+, and even that's lucky.
i wish i took this course at kwantlen where the profs there do a better job than this one! What a waste.

At the beginning she is difficult to follow because she talks fast, but you learn to get used to it.  As long as you study for the exam you'll do allright...the midterm is definitely pretty hard though.  She seems to know a lot, but teaches exactly to the textbook, so do the readings.

Completely useless class, she talks very fast and is incomprehensible at times. Class is basically straight from the textbook and very uninteresting. Teaching style is very dull, and midterms are incredibly difficult for an intro course but at the same time they baby you in the tutorials. Not good.
Talks REALLY fast and read directly from notes with her head down most of the time.  TA seems hard and class isn't curved!! Lots of material to know. Exam consists of m/c short answer and long answer

awesome prof seriously...for the exams u definitely don't need to even use the textbook...everything is out of his lecture notes 100%....just borrow the textbook when it comes to writing the term paper...so do not buy the book...and its a MAJOR GPA BOOSTER!!!

Don't be fooled by her quirkiness, she's pretty passive aggressive. The course assignments are extremely unclear, and she is very unorganized - these two traits will affect your letter grade esp. if you end up with her as a TA. She marks completely different than her  TA does, and this is based on 'creative and opinion' based assignments.

She is passionate about criminology and wrongful conviction. Lectures are not recorded. Her test is heavy on memorization. There was a lot of discussion during the lecture. She is helpful when you ask for help. Great lecturer who keeps inspiring you to think. She leaves amazing statements for you to make your own conclusions!

I wouldn't take any more classes with pam anymore. She is very unorganized, messy and all in one word, "all over the place." She takes forever to provide your grades and feedback on your assignment/tests. she doesn't play by the rules, and the whole course is creative-based. wouldn't take other courses with her again

ok so super easy class; taught about deep v heard, ted bundy, school shooters and brittney's conservatorship (dsm and all too) pam's so vv passionate and knows exactly what she's teaching, her dog comes to lecture everyday so say hi to him

Pam is so fun and so sweet. You literally can't tell she is prof cuz she treats you like yall are her friends. her lectures are so fun and she is so awesome I love her so much. However, this class is very creative meaning that her assignments require a lot of creativity and thinking so if you u r not creative dont take the class BUT SHE IS 1000/10
JUST. DONT. TAKE. A. CLASS. WITH. SARAH. biggest mistake youll ever make in youre SFU career pal

She made the course the easiest crim course i've ever taken at SFU. Niki is the best and easiest prof i've ever had.  It also helped that the TA was an esayy marker too. However, she does throw in a couple of questions from lecture, but not the notes, in the final exam.
